greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} Kronecker(-67, d).
comment: Coefficients in expansion of Dirichlet series Product_p (1-(Kronecker(m,p)+1)*p^(-s) + Kronecker(m,p)*p^(-2s))^(-1) for m = -67.
Half of the number of integer solutions to x^2 + x*y + 17*y^2 = n. Also, a(n) is the number of integral elements with norm n in Q[sqrt(-67)] counted up to association.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
N. J. A. Sloane et al., Binary Quadratic Forms and OEIS
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(67^e) = 1, a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if Kronecker(-67, p) = -1, a(p^e) = e + 1 if Kronecker(-67, p) = 1.
G.f.: Sum_{k>0} Kronecker(-67, k) * x^k / (1 - x^k).
xref: Number of integral elements with norm n in Q[sqrt(d)] counted up to association: A002324 (d=-3), A002654 (d=-4), A035182 (d=-7), A002325 (d=-8), A035179 (d=-11), A035171 (d=-19), A035147 (d=-43), this sequence (d=-67), A318983 (d=-163).
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 06 2018
